text: Glynn Stephen Lunney (November 27, 1936 â€“ March 19, 2021) was an American NASA engineer. He began working at NASA since its creation in 1958. Lunney was a flight director during the Gemini and Apollo programs. Lunney died on March 19, 2021 at his home near Houston, Texas from leukemia, aged 84. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Presidential Medal of Freedom recipients Category:American aerospace engineers Category:NASA Category:Scientists from Pennsylvania Category:Scientists from Houston
title: Glynn Lunney
